intro: Saussurea calobotrys, commonly known as the Himalayan saffron, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and yellowish to orange-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
